amendment.description: Amendment deletes language which permits non-competitive contracts that have been reported to Congress seven days after the contract has been awarded in certain circumstances.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to eliminate a bill provision which allows for non-competitive contracts to be reported to Congress seven days after the contract has been awarded in certain circumstances. Elimination of the provision will require executives agencies to inform Congress of "no-bid" contracts before they are offered.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kirk amendment Agreed to by recorded vote: 405 - 20 (Roll no. 549).
